problem_text:
For a finite group X, let χ1(X) denote the totality of the degrees of all irreducible complex characters of X with allowance for their multiplicities. Suppose that χ1(G) = χ1(H) for groups G and H. Clearly, then |G| = |H|. Is it true that H is soluble if G is soluble?
It is known that H is a Frobenius group if G is a Frobenius group.
Ya. G. Berkovich
